newsitem.title: MEXICO: Situr unit extends maturity on notes.
newsitem.headline: Situr unit extends maturity on notes.

text.p: Situr Desarrollos Turisticos (Sidetur), a subsidiary of troubled Mexican tourist firm Situr, announced on Monday that holders of its medium-term promissory notes had agreed to extend their maturity for the second time.
Sidetur said in a report to the Mexican Stock Exchange the new extension began on May 7 and will fall due on June 3 this year.

Holders had agreed the notes should maintain for the agreed term a rate of six-month Libor plus 100 basis points, Sidetur added. Sidetur said the adjusted value of the notes totalled 234 million pesos.
Situr is part of the debt-ridden conglomerate Grupo Sidek.
